did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Reports, records, correspondence, research notes, surveys and manuscripts.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Papers of Dr. Olaf Frederick Larson, professor of rural sociology.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Professor of rural sociology (retired), New York State College of Agriculture and Life Sciences, Cornell University.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes Department of Rural Sociology annual reports to the dean and budget records, 1918-1946; department research and extension reports; Larson's correspondence as head of the department, 1957-1966 and later correspondence; records of University committees chaired by Larson; material relating to the Rural Sociological Society; department historical material; and other papers of Olaf Frederick Larson.

Also, York Migrant Agricultural Working Studies(1957-1959); New York Community Study records (1924, 1930, 1936, 1974); other community studies; and files on the Northeast Regional Center for Rural Development (1972-1975).

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: New York State College of Agriculture and Life Sciences.Dept. of Rural Sociology.
Northeast Regional Center for Rural Development.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Olaf Larson papers, #21-33-1791. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

emph.ref: Series III. Department of Rural Sociology
Series VI. Northeast Regional Center for Rural Development

scopecontent.p: Survey schedules completed for each of 13 New York communities in 1924, 1930, 1936, and 1974. The first three studies were made as part of a national sample of 140 American agricultural villages, the first by the Institute of Social and Religious Research, the second by the Institute in cooperation with President Hoover's Research Committee on social trends, and the third by the Columbia University Council for Research in the Social Sciences in cooperation with the Division of Farm Population and Rural Life, Bureau of Agricultural Economics, U.S. Department of Agriculture. The fourth was made by Joseph L. Richardson, a graduate student in rural sociology, and Olaf Larson.

did.unittitle: Surveys of Community Activities: Honeoye Falls-Webster

Richfield Springs, Van Hornesville Community Studies (These two districts were chosen by the Cornell Cooperative Extension Service for an experimental project in community development. The materials include reports by the special extension agents employed for the project, reports by community committees, reports of special studies made for the project, and material related to the community surveys.)

Series VI. Northeast Regional Center for Rural Development

scopecontent.p: The Northeast Regional Center for Rural Development was established in 1972 under the Rural Development Act of 1972. It was located at Cornell by action of the agricultural experiment station directors and the extension directors of the 12 Northeastern states. It was one of four such centers in the United States. Olaf Larson was the Director during 1972-75. The material pertains to the work of the Center, its Board of Directors, its Technical Committee, and the special committees during his tenure. The files of Nyle Brady, Director of the CUAES at the time and chair of the Board of Directors, and the file of David Call, Director of Cooperative Extension at Cornell at the time, may also include material relating to the Center. A few years ago the Center was relocated to the Pennsylvania State University where it continues to be active.
